etymologies: mid 18th century: from French, named after Lorenzo Tonti (1630–95), a Neapolitan banker who started such a scheme to raise government loans in France (c1653)

definitions: an annuity shared by subscribers to a loan or common fund, the shares increasing as subscribers die until the last survivor enjoys the whole income.
shortDefinitions: annuity shared by subscribers to loan or common fund

definitions: a life insurance plan in which the beneficiaries are those who survive and maintain a policy to the end of a given period.
shortDefinitions: scheme for life assurance in which beneficiaries are those
